tit.cmt: 六道（りくどう、ろくどう）→Rikudo, Rokudo, six posthumous worlds, the six paths, the six realms[Webster's Online Dictionary, http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/]

sen.j: 六道（りくどう、ろくどう）は、仏教用語で、死後に転生するという6種類の世界のことである。
sen.e: Rokudo is a Budhism term and it means six posthumous worlds to which souls of the dead transmigrate.
sen.cmt: 転生→reincarnation, transmigration of souls[Webster's Online Dictionary]
sen.e: Rokudo is a Buddhist term and it means six posthumous worlds to which the souls of the dead transmigrate.
Rokudo is a Buddhist term and it means six posthumous worlds to which the souls of the dead transmigrate.

sen.j: それぞれ以下のとおり。
sen.e: Six worlds that constitute Rokudo are as follows.
The six worlds that constitute Rokudo are as follows.
The six worlds that constitute Rokudo are as follows.

sen.j: 地獄道（じごくどう）
sen.e: Jigoku-do (path of hells)
sen.cmt: 地獄道（じごくどう）→Jigoku-do, path of hells (地獄道)[定訳不明, http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/]
sen.e: Jigoku-do (path of hells)
Jigoku-do (world of hells)
sen.cmt: 前出「六道」を「six posthumous worlds」としているので、「world」としました。

sen.j: 餓鬼道（がきどう）
sen.e: Gaki-do (path of hungry ghosts)
sen.cmt: 餓鬼道（がきどう）→Gaki-do, path of hungry ghosts (餓鬼道)[定訳不明, http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/]
sen.e: Gaki-do (path of hungry ghosts)
Gaki-do (world of hungry ghosts)
sen.cmt: 前出「六道」を「six posthumous worlds」としているので、「world」としました。

sen.j: 畜生道（ちくしょうどう）
sen.e: Chikusho-do (path of animals)
sen.cmt: 畜生道（ちくしょうどう）→Chikusho-do, path of animals (畜生道)[定訳不明, http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/]
sen.e: Chikusho-do (path of animals)
Chikusho-do (world of animals)
sen.cmt: 前出「六道」を「six posthumous worlds」としているので、「world」としました。

sen.j: 阿修羅道（しゅらどう）
sen.e: Shura-do (path of bellicose demons)
sen.cmt: 阿修羅道（しゅらどう）→Shura-do, path of bellicose demons (修羅道)[定訳不明, http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/]
sen.e: Shura-do (path of bellicose demons)
Shura-do (world of bellicose demons)
sen.cmt: 前出「六道」を「six posthumous worlds」としているので、「world」としました。（原文「阿修羅道」はWeb上では「修羅道」となっていました）

sen.j: 人間界道（にんげんどう）
sen.e: Ningen-do (path of humans)
sen.cmt: 人間界道（にんげんどう）→Ningen-do, path of humans (人間界道)[定訳不明, http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/]
sen.e: Ningen-do (path of humans)
Ningen-do (world of humans)
sen.cmt: 前出「六道」を「six posthumous worlds」としているので、「world」としました。（原文「人間界道」はWeb上では「人間道」となっていました）

sen.j: 天 (仏教)道（てんどう、天上道、天界道とも）
sen.e: Ten (Budhism)-do (path of heavenly beings) (also called Tenjo-do or Tenkai-do)
sen.cmt: 天道（てんどう）→Ten-do, path of heavenly beings (天道)[定訳不明, http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/]天上道→Tenjo-do天界道→Tenkai-do
sen.e: Ten (Budhism)-do (path of heavenly beings) (also called Tenjo-do or Tenkai-do)
Ten-do (world of heavenly beings) (also called Tenjo-do or Tenkai-do)
sen.cmt: 前出「六道」を「six posthumous worlds」としているので、「world」としました。（原文「天 (仏教)道」はWeb上では「天道」となっているため、Webにあわせました）

sen.j: 仏教においては、この世に生を受けた迷いのある生命は死後、生前の罪により6種類の世界のいずれかに転生し、これら六道で生死を繰り返すと言う（六道輪廻）。
sen.e: According to Budhism, it is believed that stray lives that came in the world will transmigrate after death to one of six posthumous world depending on crimes they committed while alive and repeat life and death in each of Rokudo where they transmigrated (Rokudo-rinne, Rebirth in the Six Worlds).
sen.cmt: 六道輪廻→Rokudo-rinne, Rebirth in the Six Worlds[http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110004672240/]
sen.e: According to Buddhism, it is believed that stray lives that came in to the world will transmigrate after death to one of six posthumous world depending on the crimes they committed while alive and repeat life and death in each of the Rokudo where they transmigrated (Rokudo-rinne, Rebirth in the Six Worlds).

According to Buddhism, it is believed that stray lives that came in to the world will transmigrate after death to one of six posthumous world depending on the crimes they committed while alive and repeat life and death in each of the Rokudo where they transmigrated (Rokudo-rinne, Rebirth in the Six Worlds).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを除きました。

sen.j: たとえ天道であっても苦しみの輪廻する世界を脱することは出来ない。
sen.e: Even those transmigrated to Ten-do cannot escape from the rebirth of pain.
Even those transmigrated to Ten-do cannot escape from the rebirth of pain.
Even those transmigrated to Ten-do cannot escape from the rebirth of pain.

sen.j: 諸行無常の原則により、どの世界に生まれ変わろうとも何時かは死に絶え、別の世界（或いは同一世界）へ転生する宿命とされる。
sen.e: Based on the principle of all worldly things are transitory, it is believed that lives are destined to die out eventually and transmigrate to another world (or the same world) regardless of the world to which they transmigrated.
sen.cmt: 諸行無常→all worldly things are transitory, the impermanence of worldly things[Webster's Online Dictionary]
sen.e: Based on the principle that all worldly things are transitory, it is believed that lives are destined to die out eventually and transmigrate to another world (or the same world) regardless of the world to which they transmigrated.

Based on the principle that all things are in flux and nothing is permanent, it is believed that lives are destined to die out eventually and transmigrate to another world (or the same world) regardless of the world to which they transmigrated.
sen.cmt: 用語を他の記事にあわせました。

sen.j: 上記6種の世界は、須弥山世界観等においてはしばしば空間的領域として捉えられる。
sen.e: Under the world view of Shumisen (Mt. Sumeru), six worlds mentioned above are sometimes understood as space.
Under the world view of Shumisen (Mt. Sumeru), the six worlds mentioned above are sometimes understood as space.
Under the world view of Shumisen (Mt. Sumeru), the six worlds mentioned above are sometimes understood as space.

sen.j: なお一部には、天狗など、この輪廻の道から外れたものを俗に外道（魔縁）という。
sen.e: Those lives that deviated from the road of the wheel of life, such as Tengu (braggart), are commonly called Gedo (Maen).
sen.cmt: 天狗→Tengu, braggart[Webster's Online Dictionary]外道→Gedo, heretical doctrine [Webster's Online Dictionary]魔縁→Maen[kotobank]
sen.e: Those lives that deviated from the road of the wheel of life, such as Tengu (braggart), are commonly called Gedo (Maen).
Those lives that deviated from the road of the wheel of life, such as Tengu (braggart), are commonly called Gedo (Maen).

sen.j: 右上資料画像の図のような輪廻を表した絵ではそれぞれ、
sen.e: In the picture depicting the wheel of life, such as the one shown upper right,
In the picture depicting the wheel of life, such as the one shown in upper right,
In the picture depicting the wheel of life, such as the one shown in upper right,

sen.j: 怪物と骸骨 - 十二支縁起の根である無知(無明)と無常
sen.e: monster and skelton represent ignorance (Mumy) and uncertainty that the root of Twelve-fold Chain of Dependent Origination,
sen.cmt: 十二支縁起→Twelve-fold Chain of Dependent Origination, Twelve Links of Dependent Origination[http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002663558/en, http://buddhism.about.com/od/basicbuddhistteachings/tp/twelvelinks.htm]無知→ignorance[Webster's Online Dictionary]無明→Mumyo, avidya[英辞郎 on the WEB]無常→uncertainty, absence of absolutes, anicca, transience[Webster's Online Dictionary, 英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: monster and skelton represent ignorance (Mumy) and uncertainty regarding the root of the Twelve-fold Chain of Dependent Origination,
monster and skeleton represent ignorance (Mumyo) and uncertainty regarding the root of the Twelve-fold Chain of Dependent Origination,

sen.j: 外周の円環 - 人の行い(縁起)
sen.e: the outer circular ring represents human behavior (omen),
the outer circular ring represents human behavior (omen),
the outer circular ring represents human behavior (omen),

sen.j: 次の内側ドーナツ - 六道(この絵では天と人と阿修羅が同じ場にある)
sen.e: the second circular ring represents Rokudo (in this picture, Ten, human being and Ashura occupy the same place),
the second circular ring represents Rokudo (in this picture, Ten, human beings and Ashura occupy the same place),
the second circular ring represents Rokudo (in this picture, heavenly beings, human beings and Ashura occupy the same place),

sen.j: 最も内側の円環 - 人
sen.e: the inner circular ring represents human being, and
the inner circular ring represents human beings, and
the inner circular ring represents human beings, and

sen.j: 真ん中の円 - 苦しみの因なる怒り(蛇が象徴)と無知たる愚かさ(豚)と貪欲さ(鳥)
sen.e: the circle in the middle represents wrath (symbolized by snakes) that is the cause of pain, stupidness (pigs) that represents ignorance and greed (birds)
the circle in the middle represents wrath (symbolized by snakes) that is the cause of pain, stupidness (pigs) that represents ignorance and greed (birds)
the circle in the middle represents wrath (symbolized by snakes) that is the cause of pain, folly (pigs) that represents ignorance and greed (birds)

sen.j: を表している。
sen.e: respectively.
respectively.
respectively.

sen.j: 六道には、観音の導きによりその世界から救われるという来世的な観音信仰が生まれ、それぞれ6つの役割をもった観音が救うとされた。
sen.e: In connection with Rokudo, the belief that souls are saved from the world to which they transimmigrated by the guidance of Kannon (Deity of Mercy), called Kannon belief, was generated and it was believed that six different Kannon bear respective roles.
sen.cmt: 観音→Kannon, Deity of Mercy[Yahoo辞書, 英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: In connection with Rokudo, the belief that souls are saved from the world to which they transimmigrated by the guidance of Kannon (Deity of Mercy), called Kannon belief, was generated and it was believed that six different Kannon bear respective roles.

In connection with Rokudo, the belief of afterlife that souls are saved from the world to which they transmigrated by the guidance of Kannon (Deity of Mercy), called Kannon belief, was generated and it was believed that six different Kannon bear respective roles.

sen.j: これを六観音と呼ぶ。
sen.e: These are called Roku-kannon.
These are called Roku-kannon.
These are called Roku Kannon (the six Kannon).

sen.j: なお天台宗と真言宗では人間道における解釈が異なり、不空羂索観音と准胝観音がそれぞれ置かれている。
sen.e: Tendai sect and Shingon sect adopt different interpretation concerning Ningen-do and Fukukensaku Kannon and Jundei Kannon are adopted respectively.
sen.cmt: 天台宗→Tendai sect真言宗→Shingon sect[英辞郎 on the WEB]不空羂索観音→Fukukensaku Kannon[http://www.asahi.com/travel/hotoke/OSK200605160025.html]准胝観音→Jundei Kannon[Yahoo辞書]
sen.e: Tendai sect and Shingon sect adopt different interpretations concerning Ningen-do and Fukukensaku Kannon and Jundei Kannon are adopted, respectively.
Tendai sect and Shingon sect adopt different interpretations concerning Ningen-do and Fukukensaku Kannon (Kannon of the Never Empty Lasso) and Jundei Kannon (Cundi) are adopted, respectively.
sen.cmt: 「不空羂索観音」、「准胝観音」の英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 七観音と呼ばれる場合はこの2観音を含めた観音のこととなる。
sen.e: When called Hichi-Kannon, these two kannon are included.
When called Hichi-Kannon, these two kannon are included.
When called Shichi Kannon (the seven Kannon), these two Kannon are included.

sen.j: 六道
sen.e: Rokudo
Rokudo
Rokudo

sen.j: 真言宗の六観音
sen.e: Roku-kannon in Shingon sect
Roku-kannon in Shingon sect
Roku Kannon in Shingon sect

sen.j: 天台宗の六観音
sen.e: Roku-kannon in Tendai sect
Roku-kannon in Tendai sect
Roku Kannon in Tendai sect

sen.j: 地獄道聖観音聖観音
sen.e: Jigoku-do Sho Kannon Sho Kannon
Jigoku-do Sho Kannon Sho Kannon
Jigoku-do; Sho-Kannon (Sacred Kannon, or Aryavalokitesvara); Sho Kannon

sen.j: 餓鬼道千手観音千手観音
sen.e: Gaki-do Senju Kannon Senju Kannon
Gaki-do Senju Kannon Senju Kannon
Gaki-do; Senju Kannon (Thousand Armed Kannon, or Thousand Armed Avalokiteshwara); Senju Kannon
sen.cmt: 原文では表で、3列分の文字列が1行になっているため、「;」で3つに分けました。

sen.j: 畜生道馬頭観音馬頭観音
sen.e: Chikusho-do Bato Kannon Bato Kannon
Chikusho-do Bato Kannon Bato Kannon
Chikusho-do; Bato Kannon (horse-headed Kannon); Bato Kannon

sen.j: 修羅道十一面観音十一面観音
sen.e: Shura-do Juichimen Kannon Juichimen Kannon
Shura-do Juichimen Kannon Juichimen Kannon
Shura-do; Juichimen Kannon (Eleven-faced Kannon); Juichimen Kannon
sen.cmt: 原文では表で、3列分の文字列が1行になっているため、「;」で3つに分けました。

sen.j: 人間道准胝観音不空羂索観音
sen.e: Ningen-do Jundei Kannon Fukukensaku Kannon
Ningen-do Jundei Kannon Fukukensaku Kannon
Ningen-do; Jundei Kannon; Fukukensaku Kannon
sen.cmt: 原文では表で、3列分の文字列が1行になっているため、「;」で3つに分けました。

sen.j: 天道如意輪観音如意輪観音
sen.e: Ten-do Nyoirin Kannon Nyoirin Kannon
Ten-do Nyoirin Kannon Nyoirin Kannon
Ten-do; Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion); Nyoirin Kannon
sen.cmt: 原文では表で、3列分の文字列が1行になっているため、「;」で3つに分けました。

tit.e: Difference concerning the view on life and death
Difference concerning the view on life and death
Difference concerning the view on life and death

sen.j: 悟りを開き仏として目覚める事（涅槃）は、主に生存活動の最中において為され、単純な死を契機とはしない。
sen.e: Nnirvana, which means awakening to Budha through Satori (enlightment), can be achieved while in life, not necessarily triggered simply by death
sen.cmt: 悟り→Satori, enlightenment[英辞郎 on the WEB]仏→Buddha[英辞郎 on the WEB]涅槃→nirvana[英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: Nirvana, which means awakening to Buddha through Satori (enlightment), can be achieved while in life, and is not necessarily triggered simply by death
Nirvana, which means awakening to Buddha through Satori (enlightenment), can be achieved while in life, and is not necessarily triggered simply by death.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 涅槃は死後に別世界にて生まれ変わる現象とは根本的に意味合いが異なり、仏専用の別世界が用意されている訳ではなく、釈迦に代表されるように、仏として目覚めた後も死亡（入滅）までは従来の世界で暮らし続ける。
sen.e: Nirvana is fundamentally different notion from the phenomenon of posthumous transmigration and as represented by Shaka, human beings can live in the same world as before until their death even after awakening to Budha since no special world is prepared for Budha.
sen.cmt: 釈迦→Shaka入滅→dying, death, entering nirvana[Webster Online Dictionary]
sen.e: Nirvana is a fundamentally different notion from the phenomenon of posthumous transmigration and as represented by Shaka, human beings can live in the same world as before until their death even after awakening to Buddha since no special world is prepared for Buddha.

Nirvana is a fundamentally different notion from the phenomenon of posthumous transmigration and as represented by Shaka, human beings can live in the same world as before until their death even after awakening to Buddha since no special world is prepared for Buddha.

sen.j: 涅槃は六道と比較すると、精神的領域だと解釈出来る。
sen.e: Compared with Rokudo, nirvana can be understood as more psychological notion.
Compared with Rokudo, nirvana can be understood as a more psychological notion.
Compared with Rokudo, nirvana can be understood as a more psychological notion.

sen.j: また、浄土教等に見受けられる浄土なる世界は、六道輪廻確立より更に後代の思想である。
sen.e: Historically, the pure land philosophy that is held by Jodo-kyo etc. was established far after the establishment of Roku-do rinne philosophy.
sen.cmt: 浄土教→pure land teachings, Jodo-kyo[Webster Online Dictionary]浄土→Buddhist paradise, pure land Buddhist sect, the pure land[Webster Online Dictionary]
sen.e: Historically, the pure land philosophy that is held by Jodo-kyo etc. was established long after the establishment of Roku-do rinne philosophy.
Historically, the pure land philosophy that is held by Jodo-kyo etc. was established long after the establishment of Rokudo-rinne philosophy.
sen.cmt: 前出用語と表記をあわせました。

sen.j: 浄土は死後に行き着くと言う点では六道と共通するものの、六道輪廻の思想で説かれる世界観とは基本的に別物である。
sen.e: The pure land is common with Roku-do in the sense of place where the dead are destined to go but it is a completely different notion from the world-view under the philosophy of Roku-do rinne.
The pure land is common with Roku-do in the sense of a place where the dead are destined to go, but it is a completely different notion from the world-view under the philosophy of Roku-do rinne.
The pure land is common with Rokudo in the sense of a place where the dead are destined to go, but it is a completely different notion from the world-view under the philosophy of Rokudo-rinne.
sen.cmt: 前出用語と表記をあわせました。

sen.j: 仏が存在する世界が即ち浄土だと位置付ける事が可能で、六道の内のいずれか一つに限定されている訳ではない。
sen.e: The pure land can be defined as the world where Budha resides in and it is not limitted to one of Roku-do.
The pure land can be defined as the world where Buddha resides and is not limited to one of the Roku-do.
The pure land can be defined as the world where Buddha resides and is not limited to one of the Rokudo.
sen.cmt: 前出用語と表記をあわせました。

tit.cmt: 前出用語と表記をあわせました。

sen.j: 天道
sen.e: Ten-do
Ten-do
Ten-do

sen.j: 天道は天人が住まう世界である。
sen.e: Ten-do is the world where Tenjin reside in.
Ten-do is the world where Tenjin reside.
Ten-do is the world where Tenjin (heavenly beings) reside.
sen.cmt: 「天人」の英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 天人は人間よりも優れた存在とされ、寿命は非常に長く、また苦しみも人間に比べてほとんどないとされる。
sen.e: Tenjin are believed to be superior to human beings with very long life-span and far less pain compared with human beings.
Tenjin are believed to be superior to human beings with very long life-spans and far less pain compared with human beings.
Tenjin are believed to have very long life-spans and be better and far less pain than human beings.

sen.j: また、空を飛ぶことができ享楽のうちに生涯を過ごすといわれる。
sen.e: Tenjin are also believed to be able to fly in the sky and spend a life of pleasure.
Tenjin are also believed to be able to fly in the sky and spend a life of pleasure.
Tenjin are also believed to be able to fly in the sky and spend a life of pleasure.

sen.j: しかしながら煩悩から解き放たれては居ない。
sen.e: But Tenjin are not relieved from Bonno (earthly desires).
sen.cmt: 煩悩→Bonno, earthly desires, foul passion, worldly desires[英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: But Tenjin are not relieved from Bonno (earthly desires).
But Tenjin are not relieved from Bonno (earthly desires).

sen.j: 天人が死を迎えるときは五つの変化が現れる。
sen.e: When Tenjin are dying, it is believed that five changes appear.
When Tenjin are dying, it is believed that five changes occur.
When Tenjin are dying, it is believed that five changes occur.

sen.j: これを五衰（天人五衰）と称し、体が垢に塗れて悪臭を放ち、脇から汗が出て自分の居場所を好まなくなり、頭の上の花が萎む。
sen.e: These changes are called Gosui (Tenjin Gosui) and when such changes occur, they stink with their body being covered in grime, they sweat from underarm, they become less fond of the place where they reside in and flowers on their heads wither.
sen.cmt: 五衰→Gosui天人五衰→Tennin Gosui, The Decay of an Angel [http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110000439103/]
sen.e: These changes are called Gosui (Tenjin Gosui) and when such changes occur, they stink with their body being covered in grime, they sweat from the underarms, they become less fond of the place where they reside and flowers on their heads wither.

These changes are called Gosui (Tenjin Gosui) and when such changes occur, they stink with their body being covered in grime, they sweat from the underarms, they become less fond of the place where they reside and flowers on their heads wither.

sen.j: 人間道
sen.e: Ningen-do
Ningen-do
Ningen-do

sen.j: 人間道は文字通り人間が住む世界である。
sen.e: To the letter, Ningen-do is the world where human beings reside in.
To the letter, Ningen-do is the world where human beings reside.
Literally, Ningen-do is the world where Ningen (human beings) reside.

sen.j: 四苦八苦に悩まされる苦しみの大きい世界であるが、苦しみが続くばかりではなく楽しみもあるとされる。
sen.e: Although it is the world with so much pain, it is believed that pleasure may come after a succession of pain.
Although it is a world with so much pain, it is believed that pleasure may come after a succession of pain.
Although it is a world with so much pain, it is believed that pleasure may come after a succession of pain.

sen.j: また、仏になりうるという救いもある。
sen.e: There is also a relieve to become Budha.
There is also relief to become a Buddha.
There is also relief that those can become a Buddha.

sen.j: 修羅道
sen.e: Shura-do
Shura-do
Shura-do

sen.j: 修羅道は修羅の住まう世界である。
sen.e: Shura-do is the world where Shura reside in.
Shura-do is the world where Shura reside.
Shura-do is the world where Shura reside.

sen.j: 修羅は終始戦い、争うとされる。
sen.e: Shura are believed to fight and struggle all the time.
Shura are believed to fight and struggle all the time.
Shura are believed to fight and struggle all the time.

sen.j: 苦しみや怒りが絶えないが地獄のような場所ではなく、苦しみは自らに帰結するところが大きい世界である。
sen.e: Although it is the world where pain and anger is constantly rampant, it is not hellish place and pain can be largely attributed to oneselves in this world.
Although it is a world where pain and anger are constantly rampant, it is not a hellish place and pain can be largely attributed to oneself in this world.
Although it is a world where pain and anger are constantly rampant, it is not a hellish place and pain can be largely attributed to oneself in this world.

sen.j: 畜生道
sen.e: Chikusho-do
Chikusho-do
Chikusho-do

sen.j: 畜生道は牛馬などの世界である。
sen.e: Chikusho-do is the world where oxes and horses reside in.
Chikusho-do is the world where oxen and horses reside.
Chikusho-do is the world where oxen and horses reside.

sen.j: ほとんど本能ばかりで生きており、人間に使役されほとんどなされるがままという点は自らの力で仏の教えを得ることの出来ない状態であり、救いの少ない世界とされる。
sen.e: As oxes and horses live almost solely with instinct and are forced to work by human beings, they are unable to attain Budha's teaching by themselves and in this sense, this world is believed to be of no relief.

As oxes and horses live almost solely with instinct and are forced to work by human beings, they are unable to attain Buddha's teaching by themselves and in this sense, this world is believed to be of no relief.

As oxen and horses live almost solely with instinct and are forced to work by human beings, they are unable to attain Buddha's teaching by themselves and in this sense, this world is believed to be of less relief.
sen.cmt: 表現を少し変えました。

sen.j: 餓鬼道
sen.e: Gaki-do
Gaki-do
Gaki-do

sen.j: 餓鬼道は餓鬼の世界である。
sen.e: Gaki-do is the world where Gaki reside in.
Gaki-do is the world where Gaki reside.
Gaki-do is the world where Gaki (preta) reside.

sen.j: 餓鬼は腹が膨れた姿の鬼で、食べ物を口に入れようとすると灰となってしまい餓えと渇きに悩まされる。
sen.e: Gaki have appearances of demon with bloated belly and they always suffer from hunger and thirst because food becomes ash when they are set to eat.
Gaki have the appearance of a demon with a bloated belly and they always suffer from hunger and thirst because food becomes ash when they are set to eat.
Gaki have the appearance of a demon with a bloated belly and they always suffer from hunger and thirst because food becomes ash when they are set to eat.

sen.j: 前世において他人を慮らなかったために落とされた例がある。
sen.e: There is an exaple of a person who was thrown into this world because he didn't care for other people while in life..
There is an example of a person who was thrown into this world because he didn't care for other people while in life..
There is an example of a person who was thrown into this world because he didn't care for other people while in life..

sen.j: 旧暦7月15日の施餓鬼会はこの餓鬼を救うために行われる。
sen.e: Segaki-e (hungry ghosts' feeding rites) is held on July 15 of lunar calender in order to save these Gaki.
Segaki-e (hungry ghosts' feeding rites) is held on July 15 of lunar calendar in order to save these Gaki.
Segaki-e (hungry ghosts' feeding rites) is held on July 15 of lunar calendar in order to save these Gaki.

sen.j: 地獄道
sen.e: Jigoku-do
Jigoku-do
Jigoku-do

sen.j: 地獄道は生前の罪を償わせるための世界である。
sen.e: Jigoku-do is the world for making human beings atone for crimes committed during their life.
Jigoku-do is the world for making human beings atone for crimes committed during their life.
Jigoku-do is the world for making human beings atone for crimes committed during their life.

sen.j: 詳細は地獄 (仏教)を参照のこと。
sen.e: Refer to Jigoku (Budhism) for details.
Refer to Jigoku (Budhism) for details.
Refer to Jigoku (Buddhism) for details.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: このうち、地獄から畜生までを三悪趣（三悪道、あるいは三悪、三途）と呼称し、これに対し修羅から天上までを三善趣と呼称する場合がある。
sen.e: Concerning the above six world, Jigoku, Gaki and Chikusho are sometimes collectively called San-akushu (San-akudo,Sanaku or Sanzu) and Shura, Ningen and Ten are collectively called San-zenshu.
sen.cmt: 三悪趣→San-akushu, the world of hungry spirits and the world of animals, three evil worlds hell[http://www.eudict.com/?lang=engjpk&word=world%20language]三悪道→San-akudo[http://www.eudict.com/?lang=engjpk&word=world%20language]三悪→Sanaku[kotobank]三途→Sanzu[kotobank]三善趣→San-zenshu[kotobank]
sen.e: Concerning the above six worlds, Jigoku, Gaki and Chikusho are sometimes collectively called San-akushu (San-akudo, Sanaku or Sanzu) and Shura, Ningen and Ten are collectively called San-zenshu.

Concerning the above six worlds, Jigoku, Gaki and Chikusho are sometimes collectively called San-akushu (literally, three bad realms, San-akudo, Sanaku or Sanzu) and Shura, Ningen and Ten are collectively called San-zenshu (literally, three good realms).

sen.j: また地獄から修羅までを四悪趣と称することもある。
sen.e: Jigoku, Gaki, Chikusho and Shura are sometimes collectively called Shi-akushu.
Jigoku, Gaki, Chikusho and Shura are sometimes collectively called Shi-akushu.
Jigoku, Gaki, Chikusho and Shura are sometimes collectively called Shi-akushu (literally, four good realms).

sen.j: また六道から修羅を除いて五趣と称すこともある。
sen.e: Further, Roku-do other than Shura are sometimes collectively called Goshu.
Further, Roku-do other than Shura are sometimes collectively called Goshu.
Further, Rokudo other than Shura are sometimes collectively called Goshu (literally, five realms).

sen.j: 初期仏教では、地獄・餓鬼・畜生・人間・天上を五趣とし、修羅はなかった。
sen.e: Under early Buddhism, Jigoku, Gaki, Chikusho, Ningen and Ten were collectively called Goshu and Shuar didn't exist.
Under early Buddhism, Jigoku, Gaki, Chikusho, Ningen and Ten were collectively called Goshu and Shuar did not exist.
Under early Buddhism, Jigoku, Gaki, Chikusho, Ningen and Ten were collectively called Goshu and Shura did not exist.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: つまり五趣の方が六道より古い概念とされる。
sen.e: Therefore, Goshu is deemed as older notion than Roku-do.
Therefore, Goshu is deemed as an older notion than Roku-do.
Therefore, Goshu is deemed as an older notion than Rokudo.
sen.cmt: 前出用語と表記をあわせました。

sen.j: これは当初、修羅（阿修羅）が、天部に含まれていたもので、大乗仏教になってから天部から修羅が派生して六道となった。
sen.e: Originally, Shura (Ashura) was included in Tembu (Deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another) but after Mahayana Buddhism was established, Shura derived from Temmbu and became Roku-do.
sen.cmt: 天部→Tembu, Deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another[http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm]大乗仏教→Mahayana Buddhism[Webster Online Dictionary]
sen.e: Originally, Shura (Ashura) was included in Tembu (Deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another) but after Mahayana Buddhism was established, Shura derived from Temmbu and became Roku-do.

Originally, Shura (Ashura) was included in Tenbu (Deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another) but after Mahayana Buddhism was established, Shura derived from Tenbu and became Rokudo.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: したがって、これらを一括して五趣六道という。
sen.e: Therefore, these two notions are collectively called Five Realms Six Paths.
Therefore, these two notions are collectively called Five Realms Six Paths.
Therefore, these two notions are collectively called Five Realms Six Paths.

sen.j: 仏教成立以前の古代インド思想を起源とし、原始仏教においてはさほど重大な意味を為さない。
sen.e: Roku-do originated from ancient Indian philosophy before the establishment of Buddhism and had not so significant meaning in early Buddhism.
Roku-do originated from ancient Indian philosophy before the establishment of Buddhism and did not have a significant meaning in early Buddhism.
Rokudo originated from ancient Indian philosophy before the establishment of Buddhism and did not have a significant meaning in early Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 前出用語と表記をあわせました。

sen.j: 体系化が進行したのは後代と考えられる。
sen.e: It is perceived that systematization proceeded in later stage of history.
It is perceived that systematization proceeded at a later stage in history.
It is perceived that systematization proceeded at a later stage in history.

sen.j: インド・中国起源ではないが、日本では11世紀ころ、六道の各々に配当された地蔵菩薩六地蔵が各所に祀られ、大いに庶民から信仰された。
sen.e: Though not originated from India or China, Jizo Bosatsu Roku-Jizo which are allocated in each of Roku-do was enshrined throughout Japan in 11th century and widly worshiped by ordinary people.
Though not originating from India or China, Jizo Bosatsu Roku-Jizo which are allocated in each Roku-do, were enshrined throughout Japan in the 11th century and widely worshipped by ordinary people.

Although not originating from India or China, Roku Jizo (six Jizo Bodhisattva) which are allocated in each Rokudo, were enshrined throughout Japan in the 11th century and widely worshipped by ordinary people.
sen.cmt: 原文「地蔵菩薩六地蔵」はWeb上では「六地蔵」で「地蔵菩薩」はポップアップコメントでしたので、「六地蔵」としました。Though →Although に変更しました。
